# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceed. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = []
    for i in 1:length(str)
        if (i - 1) % text_width == text_width - 1  # Check if current position is at the end of a line
            push!(lines, str[i])                 # If so, add the last character to the line
        else
            push!(lines, str[1:i])               # Otherwise, add the current line without the last character
        end
    end
    return join(lines, "\n")  # Join all lines with a newline character
end
```

Example usage:

```julia
wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines") == "This\nfunction\nwill\nwrap\nwords\ninto\nlines"
```
